question.text: Paragraph: In a mixture of $\mathrm{H}-\mathrm{H}^{+}$gas $\left(\mathrm{He}^{+}\right.$is singly ionised $\mathrm{He}$ atom), $\mathrm{H}$ atoms and $\mathrm{He}^{+}$ions are excited to their respective first excited states. Subsequently, $\mathrm{H}$ atoms transfer their total excitation energy to $\mathrm{He}^{+}$ions (by collisions). Assume that the Bohr model of atom is exactly valid.Question: The wavelength of light emitted in the visible region by $\mathrm{He}^{+}$ions after collisions with $\mathrm{H}$ atoms is
